definition: the trait of appreciating and being able to express the humorous, put into a good mood
details:
noun
- the trait of appreciating and being able to express the humorous
= example: the trait of appreciating and being able to express the humorous
= synonyms: humour, sense of humor, sense of humour
- the quality of being funny
= example: the quality of being funny
= synonyms: humour
- the liquid parts of the body
= synonyms: humour, liquid body substance, bodily fluid, body fluid
- (Middle Ages) one of the four fluids in the body whose balance was believed to determine your emotional and physical state
= example: (Middle Ages) one of the four fluids in the body whose balance was believed to determine your emotional and physical state
= synonyms: humour
- a message whose ingenuity or verbal skill or incongruity has the power to evoke laughter
= synonyms: humour
- a characteristic (habitual or relatively temporary) state of feeling
= synonyms: temper
verb
- put into a good mood
= synonyms: humour
